Operation 'key_revoke_nosecret' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the two-step verification flow and doesn't explicitly state that this is a verification-based alternative to secret-based revocation. Added context about the verification process, side effects (code sent to email), and the requirement for a second call to complete the operation for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Revoke an Authentiq ID using email & phone.

If called with `email` and `phone` only, a verification code 
will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.
data.summary_suggestion: Revoke Authentiq ID via email and phone verification
data.description_suggestion: Initiates revocation of an Authentiq ID using email and phone verification. First call with email and phone parameters triggers a verification code sent to the provided email address. Second call must include the verification code to complete the revocation. This two-step process ensures authorized revocation without requiring the original revocation secret.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the two-step verification flow and doesn't explicitly state that this is a verification-based alternative to secret-based revocation. Added context about the verification process, side effects (code sent to email), and the requirement for a second call to complete the operation for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'key_register' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Missing summary. Description is overly technical with version-specific details that obscure the core operation. Improved AI agent interpretability by explaining what the operation does and what to expect.

data.current_description:
Register a new ID `JWT(sub, devtoken)`

v5: `JWT(sub, pk, devtoken, ...)`

See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Authentiq ID by registering a self-signed JWT containing subject (sub) and device token (devtoken). The JWT format varies by API version: v4 uses JWT(sub, devtoken) while v5 uses JWT(sub, pk, devtoken, ...). Returns a 201 Created response with the registered Authentiq ID details. The request body must contain a valid self-signed JWT as specified in the AuthentiqID schema.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is overly technical with version-specific details that obscure the core operation. Clarified the action (creates/registers), input requirements (self-signed JWT with specific claims), output (201 response with ID details), and version context. Improved AI agent interpretability by explaining what the operation does and what to expect.

message: Operation 'key_revoke' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description lacks input details (what parameters are needed), output details (what is returned), and side effects (permanent invalidation). Added clarity about required parameters, authentication method, the permanent nature of revocation, and distinction from the verification-based alternative for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Revoke an Identity (Key) with a revocation secret
data.summary_suggestion: Revoke Authentiq ID using revocation secret
data.description_suggestion: Revokes an Authentiq ID (Identity/Key) using the revocation secret. Requires the public key (PK) as a path parameter and the revocation secret for authentication. This operation permanently invalidates the specified Authentiq ID. Returns 200 OK on successful revocation. This is the secret-based revocation method; use key_revoke_nosecret for email/phone verification-based revocation.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input details (what parameters are needed), output details (what is returned), and side effects (permanent invalidation). Added clarity about required parameters, authentication method, the permanent nature of revocation, and distinction from the verification-based alternative for better AI agent decision-making.

Added context about what information is returned (public details), authentication requirements (none), and use cases to help AI agents understand when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Get public details of an Authentiq ID.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve public details of Authentiq ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the public details of an Authentiq ID identified by its public key (PK). Returns publicly accessible information about the Authentiq ID without requiring authentication. Useful for verifying ID existence and accessing non-sensitive identity information.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is minimal and lacks output details. Added context about what information is returned (public details), authentication requirements (none), and use cases to help AI agents understand when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'key_retrieve' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Missing summary. Description is vague ('HEAD info'). Clarified that this is a HEAD request for metadata/existence checking, explained the response format (headers only, no body), and provided context about use cases for AI agent interpretability.

data.summary_suggestion: Check Authentiq ID existence and metadata
data.description_suggestion: Performs a HEAD request to check the existence and retrieve metadata headers for an Authentiq ID identified by its public key (PK). Returns HTTP headers without a response body, allowing efficient verification of ID existence and access to metadata without downloading full details. Useful for status checks and conditional operations.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is vague ('HEAD info'). Clarified that this is a HEAD request for metadata/existence checking, explained the response format (headers only, no body), and provided context about use cases for AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'key_update' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Missing summary. Description is version-specific and unclear about inputs/outputs. Clarified the action (updates properties), input format (JWT with email/phone scopes), required parameters (PK), request schema (AuthentiqID), response (200 with updated ID), and version compatibility notes for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
update properties of an Authentiq ID.
(not operational in v4; use PUT for now)

v5: POST issuer-signed email & phone scopes in
a self-signed JWT

See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples
data.summary_suggestion: Update Authentiq ID properties via JWT
data.description_suggestion: Updates properties of an Authentiq ID by submitting issuer-signed email and phone scope claims in a self-signed JWT. Requires the public key (PK) as a path parameter and an AuthentiqID JWT in the request body. Returns 200 OK with the updated Authentiq ID. Note: Not operational in v4; use PUT (key_bind) for v4 compatibility. In v5, this operation allows updating identity claims through JWT-based updates.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is version-specific and unclear about inputs/outputs. Clarified the action (updates properties), input format (JWT with email/phone scopes), required parameters (PK), request schema (AuthentiqID), response (200 with updated ID), and version compatibility notes for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'key_bind' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Missing summary. Description is version-specific and lacks clarity about inputs/outputs. Clarified the action (replaces/updates ID), input format (JWT), required parameters (PK), request schema (AuthentiqID), response (200 with updated ID), version differences, and distinction from POST for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Update Authentiq ID by replacing the object.

v4: `JWT(sub,email,phone)` to bind email/phone hash; 

v5: POST issuer-signed email & phone scopes
and PUT to update registration `JWT(sub, pk, devtoken, ...)`

See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples
data.summary_suggestion: Replace Authentiq ID with updated JWT
data.description_suggestion: Replaces an Authentiq ID object by submitting an updated self-signed JWT. Requires the public key (PK) as a path parameter and an AuthentiqID JWT in the request body. In v4, binds email and phone hashes via JWT(sub,email,phone). In v5, updates registration with issuer-signed email/phone scopes in JWT(sub, pk, devtoken, ...). Returns 200 OK with the updated Authentiq ID. This is a full replacement operation; use POST (key_update) for partial updates in v5.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is version-specific and lacks clarity about inputs/outputs. Clarified the action (replaces/updates ID), input format (JWT), required parameters (PK), request schema (AuthentiqID), response (200 with updated ID), version differences, and distinction from POST for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'push_login_request' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is extremely vague ('push sign-in request'). Missing critical details about what the PushToken input contains, what the operation does with it, what response is returned, and the authentication flow context. Added explanation of push-based authentication mechanism, input/output details, and side effects (push notification sent) for AI agent clarity.

data.description_suggestion: Initiates a push-based authentication sign-in request by submitting a PushToken (self-signed JWT). The server processes the token and sends a push notification to the user's registered device for approval. Returns a 200 response with authentication status or challenge details. This operation enables out-of-band authentication where the user approves login on a separate device.
data.reasoning: Original description is extremely vague ('push sign-in request'). Missing critical details about what the PushToken input contains, what the operation does with it, what response is returned, and the authentication flow context. Added explanation of push-based authentication mechanism, input/output details, and side effects (push notification sent) for AI agent clarity.

Original description lacks actionable detail. Missing explanation of what Claims input represents, what verification process is initiated, what the 201 response contains, and the purpose of scope verification. data.description_suggestion: Submits a scope verification request by posting a Claims JWT (self- or issuer-signed). The server validates the claims and initiates a verification job to confirm the requested scope permissions. Returns a 201 response with the created verification job details including a job identifier for tracking. This operation is used to request verification of specific user claims or permissions.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks actionable detail. Missing explanation of what Claims input represents, what verification process is initiated, what the 201 response contains, and the purpose of scope verification. Added context about claims validation, job creation, and the verification workflow to help AI agents understand when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'sign_delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is missing entirely. Description is too brief and lacks context about what the job parameter is, what happens to pending verifications, what the response contains, and the permanent nature of deletion. Added job identifier context, side effects, and clarification that this cancels verification requests.

data.description_suggestion: Cancels and deletes a verification job identified by the job parameter. Removes the job from the system and any associated pending verification requests. Returns a 200 response confirming deletion. This operation is used to abort an in-progress or pending verification request. Side effect: the verification job and its state are permanently removed.
data.reasoning: Summary is missing entirely. Description is too brief and lacks context about what the job parameter is, what happens to pending verifications, what the response contains, and the permanent nature of deletion. Added job identifier context, side effects, and clarification that this cancels verification requests.

message: Operation 'sign_retrieve' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is missing. Description uses slash notation which is unclear. Missing details about what the response contains, what states a job can have, and the polling use case. Added clarity about response structure, job states, and typical usage pattern for AI agents.

data.current_description: get the status / current content of a verification job
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status and content of a verification job identified by the job parameter. Returns a 200 response containing the job's state (pending, completed, failed), any collected claims, verification results, and timestamps. Use this operation to poll for verification completion or inspect verification job details.
data.reasoning: Summary is missing. Description uses slash notation which is unclear. Missing details about what the response contains, what states a job can have, and the polling use case. Added clarity about response structure, job states, and typical usage pattern for AI agents.

data.current_description: HEAD to get the status of a verification job
data.description_suggestion: Performs a HEAD request to check the status of a verification job identified by the job parameter without retrieving the full job content. Returns HTTP headers including status indicators and metadata. This lightweight operation is useful for polling job completion status without downloading the full verification job data. Returns 200 if the job exists, 404 if not found.
data.reasoning: Summary is missing. Description starts with 'HEAD to get' which is not actionable language. Missing explanation of why HEAD is used (lightweight polling), what headers are returned, and HTTP status code meanings. Added context about the HEAD method's purpose, response headers, and status code semantics for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'sign_confirm' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable. data.description_suggestion: Confirms and approves a pending scope verification request for the job identified by the job parameter. The user or authorized party submits confirmation to approve the requested claims/permissions. Returns a 202 response indicating the confirmation has been accepted and is being processed. Side effect: the verification job transitions to confirmed state and claims are marked as approved. This operation completes the verification workflow.
data.reasoning: Summary is missing. Description 'this is a scope confirmation' is extremely vague and not actionable. data.current_description:
authority updates a JWT with its signature
See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples
data.summary_suggestion: Sign verification job with authority signature
data.description_suggestion: Updates a verification job by adding an authority's cryptographic signature to the JWT. The authority submits a signed JWT containing the verification results and their signature. Returns a 200 response with the updated, authority-signed JWT. This operation is used by issuing authorities to finalize and sign verified claims. Side effect: the verification job is marked as signed and the JWT is updated with the authority's signature.
data.reasoning: Summary is missing. Description assumes knowledge of JWT signing but lacks context about what input is expected, what the authority role is, what the response contains, and the finalization semantics.
